qas.question: What are the two subway systems in Portugal?

answers.text: Lisbon Metro and Metro Sul do Tejo in the Lisbon Metropolitan Area and Porto Metro in the Porto Metropolitan Area

qas.question: How long are each of the subway systems?
By what company have the Lisbon tram services been supplies by?

answers.text: Companhia de Carris de Ferro de Lisboa (Carris)

qas.question: For how long has the Libon tram service existed?

context: The two largest metropolitan areas have subway systems: <a0_0>Lisbon Metro and Metro Sul do Tejo in the Lisbon Metropolitan Area and Porto Metro in the Porto Metropolitan Area<a0_0/>, each with <a1_0>more than 35 km (22 mi)<a1_0/> of lines. In Portugal, Lisbon tram services have been supplied by the <a2_0>Companhia de Carris de Ferro de Lisboa (Carris)<a2_0/>, for <a3_0>over a century<a3_0/>. In Porto, a tram network, of which only a tourist line on the shores of the Douro remain, began construction on 12 September 1895 (a first for the Iberian Peninsula). All major cities and towns have their own local urban transport network, as well as taxi services.
